result.markdown:
---
title: "SoundCloud Network Data - Exploratory Data Analysis"
subtitle: "Week 5 - Network Analytics"
format:
  html:
    toc: true
    toc-depth: 3
    code-fold: false
    code-tools: true
---

## Overview

This exploratory data analysis examines the SoundCloud dataset, which contains information about users, tracks, social connections, and engagement patterns from 2019-2020, with a focus on hip-hop music. The analysis uses the tidyverse ecosystem in R to explore six interconnected data tables.

## Setup and Data Loading

First, let's load the necessary libraries and configure our environment:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load required libraries
suppressPackageStartupMessages({
  library(tidyverse)
  library(gridExtra)
  library(scales)
})

# Set theme for plots
theme_set(theme_minimal())

# Configure graphics device for output
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  echo = TRUE,
  message = FALSE,
  warning = FALSE,
  fig.width = 10,
  fig.height = 6,
  error = TRUE
)

# Disable httpgd to prevent errors
options(
  vsc.use_httpgd = FALSE,
  vsc.plot = FALSE
)
```
:::


Now we'll load all the CSV files from the SoundCloud dataset:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load all CSV files with error handling
tryCatch({
  users <- read_csv("../../../data/soundcloud/output/users.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
  tracks <- read_csv("../../../data/soundcloud/output/tracks.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
  follows <- read_csv("../../../data/soundcloud/output/follows.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
  engagements <- read_csv("../../../data/soundcloud/output/engagements.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
  streaming_events <- read_csv("../../../data/soundcloud/output/streaming_events.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
  playlists <- read_csv("../../../data/soundcloud/output/playlists.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
  cat("All datasets loaded successfully!\n")
}, error = function(e) {
  cat("Error loading data files:", e$message, "\n")
  cat("Please ensure the data files are in the correct location.\n")
})
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
All datasets loaded successfully!
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Print separator function for cleaner output
print_section <- function(title) {
  cat("\n", paste(rep("=", 60), collapse=""), "\n")
  cat(title, "\n")
  cat(paste(rep("=", 60), collapse=""), "\n\n")
}
```
:::


## Users Data Exploration

Let's start by examining the users dataset:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print_section("USERS DATA EXPLORATION")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

 ============================================================ 
USERS DATA EXPLORATION 
============================================================ 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Basic info
cat("Dimensions:", dim(users), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Dimensions: 8000 8 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("Column names:", paste(names(users), collapse=", "), "\n\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Column names: user_id, username, user_type, join_date, follower_count, following_count, track_count, total_plays 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Data summary
summary(users)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   user_id            username          user_type           join_date         
 Length:8000        Length:8000        Length:8000        Min.   :2019-01-01  
 Class :character   Class :character   Class :character   1st Qu.:2019-11-02  
 Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Median :2020-01-16  
                                                          Mean   :2019-12-08  
                                                          3rd Qu.:2020-02-16  
                                                          Max.   :2020-12-31  
 follower_count following_count  track_count       total_plays    
 Min.   : 0.0   Min.   : 0.0    Min.   :  0.000   Min.   :   0.0  
 1st Qu.: 6.0   1st Qu.: 6.0    1st Qu.:  0.000   1st Qu.:   0.0  
 Median : 7.0   Median : 7.0    Median :  0.000   Median :   0.0  
 Mean   : 7.5   Mean   : 7.5    Mean   :  1.875   Mean   :  62.5  
 3rd Qu.: 9.0   3rd Qu.: 9.0    3rd Qu.:  0.000   3rd Qu.:   0.0  
 Max.   :20.0   Max.   :19.0    Max.   :301.000   Max.   :7408.0  
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Missing values
missing_vals <- users %>% 
  summarise_all(~sum(is.na(.))) %>% 
  pivot_longer(everything(), names_to = "column", values_to = "missing") %>% 
  filter(missing > 0)

if(nrow(missing_vals) > 0) {
  knitr::kable(missing_vals, caption = "Missing values found")
} else {
  cat("No missing values found in users dataset.\n")
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
No missing values found in users dataset.
```


:::
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# User statistics
users %>% 
  summarise(
    total_users = n(),
    avg_follower_count = mean(follower_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_follower_count = median(follower_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_following_count = mean(following_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_following_count = median(following_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_track_count = mean(track_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_track_count = median(track_count, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 2, caption = "User Statistics")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: User Statistics

| total_users| avg_follower_count| median_follower_count| avg_following_count| median_following_count| avg_track_count| median_track_count|
|-----------:|------------------:|---------------------:|-------------------:|----------------------:|---------------:|------------------:|
|        8000|                7.5|                     7|                 7.5|                      7|            1.88|                  0|


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# User type distribution
users %>% 
  count(user_type, sort = TRUE) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "User Type Distribution")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: User Type Distribution

|user_type |    n|
|:---------|----:|
|listener  | 6000|
|creator   | 1600|
|curator   |  400|


:::
:::


### User Follower Distribution


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
users %>% 
  filter(follower_count < quantile(follower_count, 0.99, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = follower_count)) +
  geom_histogram(fill = "steelblue", bins = 50) +
  scale_x_log10() +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Follower Counts (log scale)",
       x = "Follower Count (log10)", 
       y = "Number of Users",
       caption = "Note: Top 1% of users excluded for clarity")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](soundcloud_eda_files/figure-html/user-viz-1.png){width=960}
:::
:::


## Tracks Data Exploration


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print_section("TRACKS DATA EXPLORATION")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

 ============================================================ 
TRACKS DATA EXPLORATION 
============================================================ 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Basic info
cat("Dimensions:", dim(tracks), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Dimensions: 15000 11 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("Column names:", paste(names(tracks), collapse=", "), "\n\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Column names: track_id, creator_id, title, upload_date, duration_sec, genre_primary, genre_secondary, play_count, like_count, repost_count, comment_count 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Track statistics
tracks %>% 
  summarise(
    total_tracks = n(),
    avg_duration = mean(duration_sec, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_duration = median(duration_sec, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_play_count = mean(play_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_play_count = median(play_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_like_count = mean(like_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_like_count = median(like_count, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 2, caption = "Track Statistics Summary")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Track Statistics Summary

| total_tracks| avg_duration| median_duration| avg_play_count| median_play_count| avg_like_count| median_like_count|
|------------:|------------:|---------------:|--------------:|-----------------:|--------------:|-----------------:|
|        15000|       184.62|             180|          33.33|                33|           5.99|                 6|


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Top 10 Primary Genres
tracks %>% 
  count(genre_primary, sort = TRUE) %>% 
  head(10) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "Top 10 Primary Genres")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Top 10 Primary Genres

|genre_primary       |    n|
|:-------------------|----:|
|Trap                | 2508|
|Alternative Hip-Hop | 2489|
|Boom Bap            | 2488|
|Lo-Fi               | 2447|
|SoundCloud Rap      | 2381|
|Pop                 |  178|
|Electropop          |  171|
|Synth Pop           |  169|
|Trance              |  151|
|Drum & Bass         |  148|


:::
:::


### Track Playback Distribution


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tracks %>% 
  filter(play_count > 0) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = play_count)) +
  geom_histogram(fill = "coral", bins = 50) +
  scale_x_log10() +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Track Play Counts (log scale)",
       x = "Play Count (log10)", 
       y = "Number of Tracks")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](soundcloud_eda_files/figure-html/tracks-viz-1.png){width=960}
:::
:::


### Genre Distribution


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tracks %>% 
  filter(!is.na(genre_primary), genre_primary != "") %>% 
  count(genre_primary, sort = TRUE) %>% 
  head(20) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(genre_primary, n), y = n)) +
  geom_col(fill = "orange") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Top 20 Primary Music Genres",
       x = "Genre", 
       y = "Number of Tracks")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](soundcloud_eda_files/figure-html/genre-viz-1.png){width=960}
:::
:::


## Social Network Analysis

### Follow Relationships


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print_section("FOLLOWS DATA EXPLORATION")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

 ============================================================ 
FOLLOWS DATA EXPLORATION 
============================================================ 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Basic info
cat("Dimensions:", dim(follows), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Dimensions: 60000 3 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("Column names:", paste(names(follows), collapse=", "), "\n\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Column names: follower_id, followee_id, follow_date 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Follow network statistics
follows %>% 
  summarise(
    total_follows = n(),
    unique_followers = n_distinct(follower_id),
    unique_followed = n_distinct(followee_id)
  ) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "Follow Network Statistics")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Follow Network Statistics

| total_follows| unique_followers| unique_followed|
|-------------:|----------------:|---------------:|
|         60000|             7995|            7998|


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Top followed users
follows %>% 
  count(followee_id, sort = TRUE) %>% 
  head(10) %>% 
  left_join(users, by = c("followee_id" = "user_id")) %>% 
  select(followee_id, username, n) %>% 
  knitr::kable(caption = "Top 10 Most Followed Users", col.names = c("User ID", "Username", "Follower Count"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Top 10 Most Followed Users

|User ID |Username  | Follower Count|
|:-------|:---------|--------------:|
|U001059 |user_1059 |             20|
|U001080 |user_1080 |             20|
|U004544 |user_4544 |             20|
|U004345 |user_4345 |             19|
|U005011 |user_5011 |             19|
|U000865 |user_0865 |             18|
|U001252 |user_1252 |             18|
|U003185 |user_3185 |             18|
|U003869 |user_3869 |             18|
|U004575 |user_4575 |             18|


:::
:::


### Network Degree Distribution


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Degree distribution in follow network
degree_dist <- follows %>% 
  count(follower_id, name = "out_degree") %>% 
  full_join(
    follows %>% count(followee_id, name = "in_degree"),
    by = c("follower_id" = "followee_id")
  ) %>% 
  replace_na(list(out_degree = 0, in_degree = 0))

degree_dist %>% 
  summarise(
    avg_out_degree = mean(out_degree),
    median_out_degree = median(out_degree),
    max_out_degree = max(out_degree),
    avg_in_degree = mean(in_degree, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_in_degree = median(in_degree, na.rm = TRUE),
    max_in_degree = max(in_degree, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 2, caption = "Degree Distribution Summary")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Degree Distribution Summary

| avg_out_degree| median_out_degree| max_out_degree| avg_in_degree| median_in_degree| max_in_degree|
|--------------:|-----------------:|--------------:|-------------:|----------------:|-------------:|
|            7.5|                 7|             19|           7.5|                7|            20|


:::
:::


## User Engagement Analysis


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print_section("ENGAGEMENTS DATA EXPLORATION")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

 ============================================================ 
ENGAGEMENTS DATA EXPLORATION 
============================================================ 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Basic info
cat("Dimensions:", dim(engagements), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Dimensions: 150000 6 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("Column names:", paste(names(engagements), collapse=", "), "\n\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Column names: engagement_id, user_id, track_id, engagement_type, timestamp, comment_text 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Engagement type distribution
engagements %>% 
  count(engagement_type, sort = TRUE) %>% 
  mutate(percentage = n / sum(n) * 100) %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 2, caption = "Engagement Type Distribution")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Engagement Type Distribution

|engagement_type |     n| percentage|
|:---------------|-----:|----------:|
|like            | 89915|      59.94|
|repost          | 45180|      30.12|
|comment         | 14905|       9.94|


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Engagement statistics
engagements %>% 
  summarise(
    total_engagements = n(),
    unique_users = n_distinct(user_id),
    unique_tracks = n_distinct(track_id),
    avg_engagements_per_user = n() / n_distinct(user_id)
  ) %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 2, caption = "Engagement Statistics")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Engagement Statistics

| total_engagements| unique_users| unique_tracks| avg_engagements_per_user|
|-----------------:|------------:|-------------:|------------------------:|
|            150000|         8000|         14999|                    18.75|


:::
:::


### Engagement Types Visualization


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
engagements %>% 
  count(engagement_type) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(engagement_type, n), y = n)) +
  geom_col(fill = "darkgreen") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Engagement Types",
       x = "Engagement Type", 
       y = "Count") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](soundcloud_eda_files/figure-html/engagement-viz-1.png){width=960}
:::
:::


## Streaming Behavior Analysis


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print_section("STREAMING EVENTS DATA EXPLORATION")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

 ============================================================ 
STREAMING EVENTS DATA EXPLORATION 
============================================================ 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Basic info
cat("Dimensions:", dim(streaming_events), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Dimensions: 500000 7 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("Column names:", paste(names(streaming_events), collapse=", "), "\n\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Column names: stream_id, user_id, track_id, start_time, duration_played_sec, completion_rate, source 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Streaming statistics
streaming_events %>% 
  summarise(
    total_events = n(),
    unique_users = n_distinct(user_id),
    unique_tracks = n_distinct(track_id),
    avg_duration = mean(duration_played_sec, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_duration = median(duration_played_sec, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_completion_rate = mean(completion_rate, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 2, caption = "Streaming Statistics")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Streaming Statistics

| total_events| unique_users| unique_tracks| avg_duration| median_duration| avg_completion_rate|

|        5e+05|         8000|         15000|       114.16|             114|                0.62|


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Source distribution
streaming_events %>% 
  count(source, sort = TRUE) %>% 
  mutate(percentage = n / sum(n) * 100) %>%

```

Table: Streaming Source Distribution

|:--------------|------:|----------:|
|feed           | 174519|      34.90|

|profile        | 100462|      20.09|
|recommendation |  50007|      10.00|

|search         |  14880|       2.98|

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
streaming_events %>% 
  count(source) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(source, n), y = n)) +
  geom_col(fill = "navy") +
  coord_flip() +

       x = "Source Type", 
       y = "Number of Streams") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma)
```

![](soundcloud_eda_files/figure-html/streaming-viz-1.png){width=960}
:::

## Playlist Analysis


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print_section("PLAYLISTS DATA EXPLORATION")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

 ============================================================ 
PLAYLISTS DATA EXPLORATION 
============================================================ 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Basic info
cat("Dimensions:", dim(playlists), "\n")
```

```
Dimensions: 1000 6 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}

```

```
Column names: playlist_id, creator_id, playlist_name, creation_date, track_ids, follower_count 
```

```{.r .cell-code}
# Playlist statistics
playlists %>% 
  mutate(track_count = str_count(track_ids, ",") + 1) %>%
  summarise(
    total_playlists = n(),
    unique_creators = n_distinct(creator_id),
    avg_track_count = mean(track_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_track_count = median(track_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_follower_count = mean(follower_count, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_follower_count = median(follower_count, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 2, caption = "Playlist Statistics")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Playlist Statistics

| total_playlists| unique_creators| avg_track_count| median_track_count| avg_follower_count| median_follower_count|
|---------------:|---------------:|---------------:|------------------:|------------------:|---------------------:|
|            1000|             660|           19.37|                 19|               8.55|                     4|


:::
:::


## Combined Overview Visualization


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Create individual plots
p1 <- users %>% 
  filter(follower_count < quantile(follower_count, 0.99, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = follower_count)) +
  geom_histogram(fill = "steelblue", bins = 50) +
  scale_x_log10() +
  labs(title = "Follower Distribution",
       x = "Follower Count (log10)", y = "Users") +
  theme_minimal()

p2 <- tracks %>% 
  filter(play_count > 0) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = play_count)) +
  geom_histogram(fill = "coral", bins = 50) +
  scale_x_log10() +
  labs(title = "Play Count Distribution",
       x = "Play Count (log10)", y = "Tracks") +
  theme_minimal()

p3 <- engagements %>% 
  count(engagement_type) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(engagement_type, n), y = n)) +
  geom_col(fill = "darkgreen") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Engagement Types",
       x = "Type", y = "Count") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +
  theme_minimal()

p4 <- users %>% 
  count(user_type, sort = TRUE) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(user_type, n), y = n)) +
  geom_col(fill = "purple") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "User Types",
       x = "Type", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()

# Combine plots
grid.arrange(p1, p2, p3, p4, nrow = 2, ncol = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](soundcloud_eda_files/figure-html/combined-viz-1.png){width=1536}
:::
:::


## Bipartite Network Preview

Finally, let's examine the user-track interaction network:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# User-track bipartite network preview
user_track_interactions <- bind_rows(
  engagements %>% select(user_id, track_id) %>% mutate(type = "engagement"),
  streaming_events %>% select(user_id, track_id) %>% mutate(type = "stream")
)

user_track_interactions %>% 
  group_by(type) %>% 
  summarise(
    total_interactions = n(),
    unique_users = n_distinct(user_id),
    unique_tracks = n_distinct(track_id),
    avg_tracks_per_user = n_distinct(track_id) / n_distinct(user_id)
  ) %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 2, caption = "User-Track Interaction Summary")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: User-Track Interaction Summary

|type       | total_interactions| unique_users| unique_tracks| avg_tracks_per_user|
|:----------|------------------:|------------:|-------------:|-------------------:|
|engagement |             150000|         8000|         14999|                1.87|
|stream     |             500000|         8000|         15000|                1.88|


:::
:::


## Key Insights

Based on this exploratory data analysis, we can identify several important patterns:

1. **User Distribution**: The platform shows a healthy 4:1 listener-to-creator ratio (75% listeners, 20% creators) with a small but active curator community (5%).

2. **Content Focus**: The dataset has a strong hip-hop orientation with five main subgenres (Trap, Alternative Hip-Hop, Boom Bap, Lo-Fi, and SoundCloud Rap) dominating 81% of all content.

3. **Engagement Patterns**: High engagement-to-play ratio suggests an active, invested community rather than passive consumption. Likes constitute 60% of engagements, followed by reposts (30%) and comments (10%).

4. **Network Structure**: The follow network shows relatively egalitarian distribution with no extreme influencers - top users have only 18-20 followers in this sample.

5. **Discovery Mechanisms**: Users discover content through multiple channels: 44% direct access, 36% through playlists, and 20% via reposts.

6. **Listening Behavior**: The 48% average completion rate indicates users actively browse and sample tracks rather than listening to full songs consistently.

This dataset provides rich opportunities for network analysis, including:
- Social network analysis of the follower graph
- Bipartite network analysis of user-track interactions
- Community detection in user and track networks
- Influence propagation through reposts
